tors  to  the  descendants.  If  these
changes occur over several generations, then, on the intelligent design-ers’
own principles, there has to be protection against the tendency of natural se-
lection to weed out the hapless intermediates. If they happen in one step,
then, again by the favored principles, there must be coordinated mutations.
Hence, even if the position would prefer to talk more vaguely of “novelties,”
it is committed to one of the options I have presented.
